title: Administrator non-SSO login
text: In case SSO breaks you can use the following backend URL to bypass SSO login which would display the normal Freshworks login page as seen below - https://k3businesstechnologies.myfreshworks.com/login/normal This is only to be used in case of emergency - use of this method is audited!
description:
In case SSO breaks you can use the following backend URL to bypass SSO login which would display the normal Freshworks login page as seen below - 

https://k3businesstechnologies.myfreshworks.com/login/normal

 

This is only to be used in case of emergency - use of this method is audited!

title: How to add a new Agent
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Raise a ticket to Node4 Add the user as an Agent Add to all SLA groups Add to all relevant country Skills Change "Set Ticket Field Options" app Change Hide/Disable Ticket Fields app to add the new agent to the list Add to rule to auto-assign when update unassigned ticket To add a new agent to Freshdesk, you need to do the following: Raise a ticket to Node4 Login - Node4 Portal to raise a Service Request that the new person is added to the k3btg.local group “SRV_CUSTSRV_Freshworks_UserAccess”. This will enable SSO to work between Freshdesk and K3 Add the user as an Agent Go to https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/agents/filter/active Tell the person in advance to ignore the email asking them to set up a password because SSO will be configured. For Support team members, add the person as Agent Type as Support agent with the role "Agent (Customer Success)" which will use a licence > Add to all SLA groups (except DK Timesheets) Add to all groups even groups which are for a different region i.e. add a new UK support agent to all the UK AND EU groups. Since the agents will be displayed only if they are part of the group and also configured in the app "Set Ticket Field Options", all agents must be added to all groups so that their names are displayed in the "Agent" field according to the Team value, while remaining assigned to the original group. This means that even if a ticket is assigned to a UK 2nd line group and the Team is NL - First Line, the required NL agents are still displayed. This can be done while adding the agent: Or by editing each group (which is a slow process via https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/groups) Add to all relevant country Skills ONLY REQUIRED IF AGENT IS 1st line Or by adding to the relevant skill later at: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/skills(note that it's quicker to do this via the Agents' Skill tab shown below Add to Team (Change "Set Ticket Field Options" app) https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/marketplace/gallery?route=installed_apps which shows selected people for each Teams. Be careful to click the Save Changes button on the left before the Save button on the right! Change Hide/Disable Ticket Fields app to add the new agent to the list For more info on how some of this works, see https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000122266-sla-config-for-business-hours-groups-skills-automation-rules Add to rule to auto-assign when update unassigned ticket This rule was set to Any Agent, but there have been some exceptions where we don't want this happening for every agent, so please add to the following rule: Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Raise a ticket to Node4
  • Add the user as an Agent
  • Add to all SLA groups
  • Add to all relevant country Skills
  • Change "Set Ticket Field Options" app
  • Change Hide/Disable Ticket Fields app to add the new agent to the list
  • Add to rule to auto-assign when update unassigned ticket


To add a new agent to Freshdesk, you need to do the following:

  1. Raise a ticket to Node4

    Login - Node4 Portal  to raise a Service Request that the new person is added to the k3btg.local group “SRV_CUSTSRV_Freshworks_UserAccess”. This will enable SSO to work between Freshdesk and K3

  2. Add the user as an Agent

    Go to https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/agents/filter/active
    Tell the person in advance to ignore the email asking them to set up a password because SSO will be configured.
    For Support team members, add the person as Agent Type as Support agent with the role "Agent (Customer Success)" which will use a licence


    << Note that if you are adding a Collaborator, you don't need to do any of the following steps >>

  3. Add to all SLA groups (except DK Timesheets)

    Add to all groups even groups which are for a different region i.e. add a new UK support agent to all the UK AND EU groups. Since the agents will be displayed only if they are part of the group and also configured in the app "Set Ticket Field Options", all agents must be added to all groups so that their names are displayed in the "Agent" field according to the Team value, while remaining assigned to the original group. This means that even if a ticket is assigned to a UK 2nd line group and the Team is NL - First Line, the required NL agents are still displayed.

    This can be done while adding the agent:

    Or by editing each group (which is a slow process via https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/groups)

  4. Add to all relevant country Skills

    ONLY REQUIRED IF AGENT IS 1st line

    Or by adding to the relevant skill later at: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/skills(note that it's quicker to do this via the Agents' Skill tab shown below

  5. Add to Team (Change "Set Ticket Field Options" app)

    https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/marketplace/gallery?route=installed_apps which shows selected people for each Teams. Be careful to click the Save Changes button on the left before the Save button on the right!

  6. Change Hide/Disable Ticket Fields app to add the new agent to the list




For more info on how some of this works, see https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000122266-sla-config-for-business-hours-groups-skills-automation-rules 

 


Add to rule to auto-assign when update unassigned ticket

This rule was set to Any Agent, but there have been some exceptions where we don't want this happening for every agent, so please add to the following rule:

Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)

title: Licences
text: Day-passes are bought in batches in advance e.g. 50, and then are used up as people with Day Pass access use them. Useful for occasional users of Freshdesk such as a Developer who wants to add to product documentation infrequently. Collaborators is great for when someone needs visibility of a ticket or needs to input to a ticket without needing to have a license, you can add up to 5000 collaborators Useful for Global Accounts? Analytics Collaborator - use for CSMs Allow them to change statuses e.g. if we pass an opportunity to them for a quote etc
description:
• Day-passes are bought in batches in advance e.g. 50, and then are used up as people with Day Pass access use them.
    • Useful for occasional users of Freshdesk such as a Developer who wants to add to product documentation infrequently.
  • Collaborators is great for when someone needs visibility of a ticket or needs to input to a ticket without needing to have a license, you can add up to 5000 collaborators
    • Useful for Global Accounts?
  • Analytics Collaborator - use for CSMs
    • Allow them to change statuses e.g. if  we pass an opportunity to them for a quote etc

title: How to contact Freshdesk Support
text: *Email: *You could always email our Support teams at the following support addresses. Take care to share your account URL and any supporting screenshots that may help them assist you. - Freshdesk Support Desk: support@freshdesk.com - Freshdesk Messaging: support@freshchat.com - Freshdesk Contact Center: support@freshcaller.com *Chat* in real-time: Administrators can also chat with our Support team using the "Help and Support" option ("?") in the top right corner of the page in Freshdesk. *Phone* or *Submit a ticket* on portal: You can also call in to the team using the phone numbers mentioned at the top right corner in our support portals below. If you have an existing ticket, it's best to share the ticket number/ID with the agent on the call so they can gain context. - Freshdesk Support Desk: https://support.freshdesk.com/en/support/home - Freshdesk Messaging: https://support.freshchat.com/support/home - Freshdesk Contact Center: https://support.freshcaller.com/en/support/home *Service disruptions* In case of any serious outages, you can refer to our status pages for updates and also subscribe to notifications. - Freshdesk Support Desk status page - Freshdesk Messaging status page - Freshdesk Contact Center status page
description:
*Email: *You could always email our Support teams at the following support
addresses. Take care to share your account URL and any supporting
screenshots that may help them assist you.

- Freshdesk Support Desk: support@freshdesk.com
- Freshdesk Messaging: support@freshchat.com
- Freshdesk Contact Center: support@freshcaller.com

*Chat* in real-time: Administrators can also chat with our Support team
using the "Help and Support" option ("?") in the top right corner of the
page in Freshdesk.

*Phone* or *Submit a ticket* on portal: You can also call in to the team
using the phone numbers mentioned at the top right corner in our support
portals below. If you have an existing ticket, it's best to share the
ticket number/ID with the agent on the call so they can gain context.

- Freshdesk Support Desk: https://support.freshdesk.com/en/support/home
- Freshdesk Messaging: https://support.freshchat.com/support/home
- Freshdesk Contact Center:
https://support.freshcaller.com/en/support/home


*Service disruptions*
In case of any serious outages, you can refer to our status pages for
updates and also subscribe to notifications.

- Freshdesk Support Desk status page <https://updates.freshdesk.com/>
- Freshdesk Messaging status page <https://status.freshchat.com/>
- Freshdesk Contact Center status page <https://status.freshcaller.com/>

title: How to add a Collaborator agent
text: For context, see What is a Freshdesk Collaborator? which doesn't use up a licence and is for K3 employees only who are not in the Support Team To add a new collaborator to Freshdesk, you need to do the following: Raise a ticket to Node4 ( servicecentre@node4.co.uk ) to request they are added to the k3btg.local group “SRV_CUSTSRV_Freshworks_UserAccess”. This will enable SSO to work between Freshdesk and K3 Tell the person in advance to ignore the email asking them to set up a password because SSO will be configured. Go to https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/agents/filter/active and add their email as a Collaborator making sure you select the correct Type, Scope and Role as shown below NOTE: Should the need arise, you cannot directly convert a Collaborator into an Agent. To convert a Collaborator into an Agent, you need to first convert them into a contact and then convert the contact into an Agent.
description:
For context, see What is a Freshdesk Collaborator? which doesn't use up a licence and is for K3 employees only who are not in the Support Team


To add a new collaborator to Freshdesk, you need to do the following:

  1. Raise a ticket to Node4

     ( servicecentre@node4.co.uk ) to request they are added to the k3btg.local group “SRV_CUSTSRV_Freshworks_UserAccess”. This will enable SSO to work between Freshdesk and K3

  2. Tell the person in advance to ignore the email asking them to set up a password because SSO will be configured.

  3. Go to https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/admin/agents/filter/active and add their email as a Collaborator making sure you select the correct Type, Scope and Role as shown below





NOTE: Should the need arise, you cannot directly convert a Collaborator into an Agent. To convert a Collaborator into an Agent, you need to first convert them into a contact and then convert the contact into an Agent.

title: How to see / change Agent availability
text: Go to the Omnichannel dashboard (usually shown as "My Dashboard for Admins", then click on View Details in the Available Agents pane (or click this link to go there direct) https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/dashboard/agent_status For more info see Adding a new custom agent status - Freshdesk Omnichannel : Freshdesk
description:
Go to the Omnichannel dashboard (usually shown as "My Dashboard for Admins", then click on View Details in the Available Agents pane (or click this link to go there direct) https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/dashboard/agent_status 


For more info see Adding a new custom agent status - Freshdesk Omnichannel : Freshdesk

title: How to Update Company & Contract Data from CRM/X3
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Get the Data Format the Data Backup Live Data before Upload Upload Data Post Upload Checks Expired Contracts Ex Customers Appendix - Known Data Issues Get the Data Logon to an RDP session i..e use the RDP login for X3 so that you are on the company network Open Companies_and_Contracts_from_DataWarehouse_for_Freshdesk from https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/sites/SDSupport-SupportLeadersandCSOps/Shared%20Documents/Support%20Leaders%20and%20CS%20Ops/Freshdesk%20Implementation/Data%20to%20Upload/ (you may need to email this link to yourself and open up Outlook on the RDP/X3 machine) In the Excel, click the Data menu and select "Refresh All". This will refresh all data in the sheets "Contract_Customers_Merge" and "Contract_Summary" Save the sheet, then you can exit the RDP session and work on the spreadsheet from your local machine. Format the Data Ensure that the first row of the "Companies_for_CSV" and "Contracts_for_CSV" have formulas which point to the first row in the "Contract_Customers_Merge" and Contract_Summary sheets respectively If they don't, then you'll need to do a Find and Replace on the first row in the CSV sheets to change the tow number to 2 Delete all data from the CSV sheets except the first row Select all cells in the first row, then drag down to the same number of rows as in the source sheets and ensure that all original rows are included, and there are no empty rows Company Name and Contract Name cannot have duplicates, so duplicates are automatically highlighted in red on each CSV tab, so filter by colour to review duplicates as per sections 8 and 9 below On the Companies for CSV: Sort by Company Name (asc) and Non-Global Product (desc) Delete all rows where the CRM Account Number or Company Name is empty or 0 Delete all rows where the company name includes "terminated" which is sometimes done in CRM For those which have a i) duplicate Account Number AND ii) a Duplicate Company Name (i.e. both are red), AND iii) different products: Merge the values in the Non-Global Product column and the following 3 columns (Imagine Customer, Data Switch Customer, Viji Customer) as in the example below. Note: a. Some rows will just be complete duplicates, or have an invalid product like "LAPTOP", b. MAKE SURE THE FIRST ROW OF THE DUPLICATES IS THE ONE WITH THE CORRECT VALUES BECAUSE THE SECOND ROW WILL BE DELETED IN THE NEXT STEP This: Becomes the below by over-writing the formula with the hard-coded value: Delete the "unmerged" row (2nd row in the example above) For any where only the company name is a duplicate Check which ones are already in Freshdesk, and delete the other duplicate rows from the Companies_for_CSV. It is likely that the duplicates are actually just stores, but they're defined with their own account in CRM Alternatively you can contact the CSM to have them rename one of the duplicates if they are separate valid accounts which should both be in FD Use Excel's Delete Duplicates function (in the Data menu) to delete all duplicates for Account Number AND Company Filter for where the Non-Global Product is blank AND the other three products are blank (i.e. the Company has no products associated with it) Check if they are in Freshdesk, and if so, update the product in the Companies_for_CSV sheet. If not, delete the row or update if in the Known Data Issues table below Filter for any where the Product is not one of the ones we support, and delete them Replace any departed CSMs for one that is still at K3 (CSM Owner and CSM Owner Email columns) On the Contracts for CSV: Sort by Contract Name Delete all rows where the contract name includes "terminated" which is sometimes done in CRM Filter by colour to review the duplicates in the Contract Name column Delete any duplicates where the contract expiry is blank It's likely they are complete duplicates, in which case simply delete the remaining ones by clicking on Data/Remove Duplicates and delete based on the Contract Name Filter for any where the Product is not one of the ones we support, and delete them (including the 3RDPARTYOTHER product which is usually a duplicate with a real product) Address known issues with data as per the table at the end of this article Backup Live Data before Upload Export all Companies from the Export option on All Companies Download data for Contracts using Contract + Site Custom Object Upload Data Export the two _for_CSV sheets to CSV files and save in the same location as the Excel *but easier to have a local copy as well for uploading) Go to Companies : K3 Support (k3btg.com) and click the Import button Once you have dragged and dropped your file, you will then need to select the correct mappings between the CSV and the Freshdesk fields. Some are automatically mapped, some not. Some fields such as "Extended Support Hours" in FreshDesk do not have a corresponding column it the CSV as that information is not available in CRM or X3. Same applies to import Contracts at Contracts You will receive an email with the upload report and attached will be any records which didn't import You can ignore errors "name ["Value can't be blank"] in the Company CSV because that's most likely a lot of blank lines at the end of the CSV You can re-download the companies from Freshdesk and do a comparison if you want to see The contract import will have some failures due to an ampersand or any other special characters not being permitted, but some of our company names have ampersands in them or other special characters. This is a bug which FD have not fixed yet. the error message is only "invalid input". For contracts with special characters, check if the Contract Expiry Date needs updating Some may fail if there is no matching company name. Check to see if you can find the company name, but if none found, then no action to take Review all contracts which were not updated/uploaded and add or amend in FD as required Post Upload Checks Expired Contracts Once all updates are complete, check for any expired contracts in the bottom widget on the Contract + Site Custom Object report (change the widget filter date by editing the report), and extract to CSV to check with Finance. Report data takes 30 mins to populate after the import - What is the refresh time for the data in Analytics? : Freshdesk If any of the expired contracts are found to be genuine (not a data issue), then put the company on stop if they have no other valid contracts as per How to Handle Ex Customers and Closed Sites Ex Customers Check if the ex-customers in the system have had a non-ex customer uploaded (i.e. a duplicate). This shouldn't happen if the customer really is an ex-customer. Do this by: Download all Companies Replace "EX-CUSTOMER - " in the Company Name field with blank Select the Company Name field and Conditional Format for duplicates Filter by colour to find any duplicates and delete from Freshdesk as necessary Appendix - Known Data Issues Identifier (Company or Contract Name) Issue Fix Frandsen P/S Two account numbers for same name customer Delete row for ACC064853 (keep ACC064891) fahrrad.de (multiple companies which start with this) They only have Imagine, not DdD Update any Companies which do not have Imagine Customer set as TRUE Delete any DdD contracts Kabooki Neumunster Incorrect/no product Set to DdD Newquay and Paignton Zoo CRM and FreshDesk previously worked on one account called South West Environmental Parks which is what the customer is used to, but each import creates a new FD company for Paignton and Newquay Update the single Contract Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com) to have the same contract details as the freshly imported ones Delete the Paignton and Newquay contracts and accounts after each import related to Paignton Zoo ACC022436 Newquay Zoo ACC021425 .
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Get the Data
  • Format the Data
  • Backup Live Data before Upload
  • Upload Data
  • Post Upload Checks
    • Expired Contracts
    • Ex Customers
  • Appendix - Known Data Issues

Get the Data

  1. Logon to an RDP session i..e use the RDP login for X3 so that you are on the company network
  2. Open Companies_and_Contracts_from_DataWarehouse_for_Freshdesk from https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/sites/SDSupport-SupportLeadersandCSOps/Shared%20Documents/Support%20Leaders%20and%20CS%20Ops/Freshdesk%20Implementation/Data%20to%20Upload/ (you may need to email this link to yourself and open up Outlook on the RDP/X3 machine)
  3. In the Excel, click the Data menu and select "Refresh All". This will refresh all data in the sheets  "Contract_Customers_Merge" and "Contract_Summary"
  4. Save the sheet, then you can exit the RDP session and work on the spreadsheet from your local machine.


Format the Data

  1. Ensure that the first row of the "Companies_for_CSV" and "Contracts_for_CSV" have formulas which point to the first row in the "Contract_Customers_Merge" and Contract_Summary sheets respectively
    1. If they don't, then you'll need to do a Find and Replace on the first row in the CSV sheets to change the tow number to 2
  2. Delete all data from the CSV sheets except the first row
  3. Select all cells in the first row, then drag down to the same number of rows as in the source sheets and ensure that all original rows are included, and there are no empty rows
  4. Company Name and Contract Name cannot have duplicates, so duplicates are automatically highlighted in red on each CSV tab, so filter by colour to review duplicates as per sections 8 and 9 below
  5. On the Companies for CSV:
    1. Sort by Company Name (asc) and Non-Global Product (desc)
    2. Delete all rows where the CRM Account Number or Company Name is empty or 0
    3. Delete all rows where the company name includes "terminated" which is sometimes done in CRM
    4. For those which have a i) duplicate Account Number AND ii) a Duplicate Company Name (i.e. both are red), AND iii) different products:
      Merge the values in the Non-Global Product column and the following 3 columns (Imagine Customer, Data Switch Customer, Viji Customer) as in the example below.
      Note:
      a. Some rows will just be complete duplicates, or have an invalid product like "LAPTOP",
      b. MAKE SURE THE FIRST ROW OF THE DUPLICATES IS THE ONE WITH THE CORRECT VALUES BECAUSE THE SECOND ROW WILL BE DELETED IN THE NEXT STEP
      1. This: 
      2. Becomes the below by over-writing the formula with the hard-coded value: 
      3. Delete the "unmerged" row (2nd row in the example above)
    5. For any where only the company name is a duplicate
      1. Check which ones are already in Freshdesk, and delete the other duplicate rows from the Companies_for_CSV. It is likely that the duplicates are actually just stores, but they're defined with their own account in CRM
      2. Alternatively you can contact the CSM to have them rename one of the duplicates if they are separate valid accounts which should both be in FD
    6. Use Excel's Delete Duplicates function (in the Data menu) to delete all duplicates for Account Number AND Company
    7. Filter for where the Non-Global Product is blank AND the other three products are blank (i.e. the Company has no products associated with it)
      1. Check if they are in Freshdesk, and if so, update the product in the Companies_for_CSV sheet. If not, delete the row or update if in the Known Data Issues table below
    8. Filter for any where the Product is not one of the ones we support, and delete them
    9. Replace any departed CSMs for one that is still at K3 (CSM Owner and CSM Owner Email columns)
  6. On the Contracts for CSV:
    1. Sort by Contract Name
    2. Delete all rows where the contract name includes "terminated" which is sometimes done in CRM
    3. Filter by colour to review the duplicates in the Contract Name column
    4. Delete any duplicates where the contract expiry is blank
      1. It's likely they are complete duplicates, in which case simply delete the remaining ones by clicking on Data/Remove Duplicates and delete based on the Contract Name
    5. Filter for any where the Product is not one of the ones we support, and delete them (including the 3RDPARTYOTHER product which is usually a duplicate with a real product)
    6. Address known issues with data as per the table at the end of this article


Backup Live Data before Upload

  1. Export all Companies from the Export option on All Companies 
  2. Download data for Contracts using Contract + Site Custom Object


Upload Data

  1. Export the two _for_CSV sheets to CSV files and save in the same location as the Excel *but easier to have a local copy as well for uploading)
  2. Go to Companies : K3 Support (k3btg.com)  and click the Import button
  3. Once you have dragged and dropped your file, you will then need to select the correct mappings between the CSV and the Freshdesk fields. Some are automatically mapped, some not. Some fields such as "Extended Support Hours" in FreshDesk do not have a corresponding column it the CSV as that information is not available in CRM or X3.
  4. Same applies to import Contracts at Contracts 
  5. You will receive an email with the upload report and attached will be any records which didn't import
    1. You can ignore errors "name ["Value can't be blank"] in the Company CSV because that's most likely a lot of blank lines at the end of the CSV
      1. You can re-download the companies from Freshdesk and do a comparison if you want to see 
    2. The contract import will have some failures due to an ampersand or any other special characters not being permitted, but some of our company names have ampersands in them or other special characters. This is a bug which FD have not fixed yet. the error message is only "invalid input".
      1. For contracts with special characters, check if the Contract Expiry Date needs updating
      2. Some may fail if there is no matching company name. Check to see if you can find the company name, but if none found, then no action to take
      3. Review all contracts which were not updated/uploaded and add or amend in FD as required


Post Upload Checks

Expired Contracts

Once all updates are complete, check for any expired contracts in the bottom widget on the Contract + Site Custom Object report (change the widget filter date by editing the report), and extract to CSV to check with Finance.


Report data takes 30 mins to populate after the import - What is the refresh time for the data in Analytics? : Freshdesk



If any of the expired contracts are found to be genuine (not a data issue), then put the company on stop if they have no other valid contracts as per How to Handle Ex Customers and Closed Sites


Ex Customers

Check if the ex-customers in the system have had a non-ex customer uploaded (i.e. a duplicate). This shouldn't happen if the customer really is an ex-customer. Do this by:

  1. Download all Companies
  2. Replace "EX-CUSTOMER - " in the Company Name field with blank
  3. Select the Company Name field and Conditional Format for duplicates
  4. Filter by colour to find any duplicates and delete from Freshdesk as necessary


Appendix - Known Data Issues

Identifier (Company or Contract Name)IssueFix
Frandsen P/STwo account numbers for same name customer Delete row for ACC064853 (keep ACC064891)
fahrrad.de (multiple companies which start with this)

They only have Imagine, not DdD
  • Update any Companies which do not have Imagine Customer set as TRUE
  • Delete any DdD contracts
Kabooki NeumunsterIncorrect/no productSet to DdD
Newquay and Paignton Zoo CRM and FreshDesk previously worked on one account called South West Environmental Parks which is what the customer is used to, but each import creates a new FD company for Paignton and Newquay
  1. Update the single Contract  Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com) to have the same contract details as the freshly imported ones
  2. Delete the Paignton and Newquay contracts and accounts after each import related to
    1. Paignton Zoo ACC022436 
    2. Newquay Zoo ACC021425


.

title: When and How to Delete an Agent
text: IT should contact Support leaders to let them know of all leavers. Support management then checks if they have an account and deactivates it. A new function was enabled in Q4 2023 to Deactivate an agent. This enables traceability of their activity, but removes their access to FD and unassigns any unresolved tickets. The process is simple to do from the Admin Agents menu, but for more detail please see Agent deactivation in Freshdesk : Freshdesk
description:
IT should contact Support leaders to let them know of all leavers. Support management then checks if they have an account and deactivates it.


A new function was enabled in Q4 2023 to Deactivate an agent. This enables traceability of their activity, but removes their access to FD and unassigns any unresolved tickets. 


The process is simple to do from the Admin Agents menu, but for more detail please see Agent deactivation in Freshdesk : Freshdesk

title: How to bulk activate new contacts
text: Tried this for bringing Walton contacts into FD on 11th Dec 2023, but it didn't work :-( There is a bulk way of sending activation emails as shown below, but it's only in groups of 30 at a time (see screenshot at the bottom of this article). There are thousands of unverified contacts in FD, so this is not practical, and if you want to bulk load new contacts and have them sent an activation email, do this: Toggle on the option to automatically send activation emails to new contacts under Admin > Email Notifications > Requester Notifications > User Activation Email Import the new contacts via CSV. They will all be sent an activation email Toggle off the option to automatically send activation emails to new contacts (this is because normally when someone registers on the portal, we link them with their company before manually sending them an activation email. Below is the only way to do this for existing contacts which is in groups of 30 contacts at a time
description:
Tried this for bringing Walton contacts into FD on 11th Dec 2023, but it didn't work :-(


There is a bulk way of sending activation emails as shown below, but it's only in groups of 30 at a time (see screenshot at the bottom of this article). There are thousands of unverified contacts in FD, so this is not practical, and if you want to bulk load new contacts and have them sent an activation email, do this:


  1. Toggle on the option to automatically send activation emails to new contacts under Admin > Email Notifications > Requester Notifications > User Activation Email
  2. Import the new contacts via CSV. They will all be sent an activation email
  3. Toggle off the option to automatically send activation emails to new contacts (this is because normally when someone registers on the portal, we link them with their company before manually sending them an activation email.



Below is the only way to do this for existing contacts which is in groups of 30 contacts at a time

title: Add / Create Companies in FreshDesk
text: The export from Dynamics CRM did not transfer All existing customers. In the below please follow this step by step guide. 1. Check or verify if the company exists in FD - If not go next (2.). Go to Companies and make simple search if company exists. 2. Create new company. Click on the tab new - Chose "New Company" 3. The following fields are mandatory when creating new company. Non-Global Product Extended Support Hours Contry Company Name VIP Customer? CSM Owner CSM Owner Email CRM Account Number Click Save! A company musthave at least one Site and one Contract, so add them from the Company screen (panels on right hand side)
description:
The export from Dynamics CRM did not transfer All existing customers. In the below please follow this step by step guide.


1. Check or verify if the company exists in FD - If not go next (2.).


Go to Companies and make simple search if company exists.


2. Create new company.


Click on the tab new - Chose "New Company"


3. The following fields are mandatory when creating new company.


  • Non-Global Product
  • Extended Support Hours
  • Contry
  • Company Name
  • VIP Customer?
  • CSM Owner
  • CSM Owner Email
  • CRM Account Number



Click Save!


A company musthave at least one Site and one Contract, so add them from the Company screen (panels on right hand side)

title: How to find the internal name of a custom field
text: Custom fields can normally be referred to by their UI name with underscores instead of spaces when referring to them in webhooks etc. Since the backend name of the ticket field might be different from the name on the UI(in cases where the field was first created with a specific name and was then updated on the UI), I would recommend using the following steps to get the field's ID. Go to the customer portal and place the cursor on the name of the field that you are looking to customize. Right-click and select "Inspect". The "id" of the field would be displayed as seen below which you could then copy and use in the code. Doesn't seem to be a way of finding this on the internal portal, so you will nbeed to make the field editable by customers, and then put on the submit ticket form, for example, so find the internal name. When you find the field name, ignore any numbers after the end of the field name IF THEY ARE SEPERATED BY UNDERSCORES e.g. the field name to use in this case would NOT include the numbers at the end cf_resolution_due_date_for_jira_2514075
description:
Custom fields can normally be referred to by their UI name with underscores instead of spaces when referring to them in webhooks etc.

 

Since the backend name of the ticket field might be different from the name on the UI(in cases where the field was first created with a specific name and was then updated on the UI), I would recommend using the following steps to get the field's ID.

  1. Go to the customer portal and place the cursor on the name of the field that you are looking to customize.
  2. Right-click and select "Inspect".

  3. The "id" of the field would be displayed as seen below which you could then copy and use in the code.


Doesn't seem to be a way of finding this on the internal portal, so you will nbeed to make the field editable by customers, and then put on the submit ticket form, for example, so find the internal name. When you find the field name, ignore any numbers after the end of the field name IF THEY ARE SEPERATED BY UNDERSCORES e.g. the field name to use in this case would NOT include the numbers at the end cf_resolution_due_date_for_jira_2514075

title: How to bulk send emails to customers / contacts
text: See Proactive Outreach by Freshdesk : Freshdesk which is a feature in the Admin panel under the Workflows section.
description: See Proactive Outreach by Freshdesk : Freshdesk which is a feature in the Admin panel under the Workflows section.

title: Date formatting in webhooks
text: If you want to format a date, you can use the following example which is ISO 8601 format, and is used in webhooks to get the correct date format for sending over to Jira { "custom_fields": { "cf_resolution_due_date_for_jira": "{{ticket.due_by_time | date: '%Y-%m-%d'}}" } } Note How to find the internal name of a custom field
description:
If you want to format a date, you can use the following example which is ISO 8601 format, and is used in webhooks to get the correct date format for sending over to Jira


{

    "custom_fields": {

        "cf_resolution_due_date_for_jira": "{{ticket.due_by_time  | date: '%Y-%m-%d'}}"

    }

}


Note How to find the internal name of a custom field

title: How to see call costs in FreshCaller
text: You can get this data from the account using the steps below. Step by step guide - quick view Create a step-by-step guide Step 1: Go to FreshCaller Step 2: Choose - Call Metric Step 3: Select filter Step 4: Choose - Numbers, Time Period, Call Directions Step 5: Filter Calls Step 6: Export - Call metric Step 1: Go to FreshCaller https://k3businesstechnology-help.freshcaller.com/ Step 2: Choose - Call Metric Step 3: Select filter Step 4: Choose - Numbers, Time Period, Call Directions Step 5: Filter Calls Step 6: Export - Call Metrics - Choose predefined selection and add Billing time and call cost
description:
You can get this data from the account using the steps below. 


Step by step guide - quick view


Create a step-by-step guide

  • Step 1: Go to FreshCaller
  • Step 2: Choose - Call Metric
  • Step 3: Select filter
  • Step 4: Choose - Numbers, Time Period, Call Directions
  • Step 5: Filter Calls
  • Step 6: Export - Call metric


Step 1: Go to FreshCaller

  • https://k3businesstechnology-help.freshcaller.com/


Step 2: Choose - Call Metric


Step 3: Select filter

Step 4: Choose - Numbers, Time Period, Call Directions

Step 5: Filter Calls

Step 6: Export - Call Metrics - Choose predefined selection and add Billing time and call cost

title: Whitelisting countries for outbound calls
text: In Freshcaller every country needs to be whitelisted for outbound calling. Most countries of our customer base are already added. In case you are not allowed to call a number, please report this to your manager so they can whitelist the country (if approved) How to whitelist In the admin section of Freshcaller you have to go to NUMBERS. When select the option for RESTRICTED COUNTRIES under MANAGE NUMBERS, you get option to search for countries After the country is selected, you can whitelist the country by selecting REMOVE RESTRICTION
description:
In Freshcaller every country needs to be whitelisted for outbound calling. Most countries of our customer base are already added.


In case you are not allowed to call a number, please report this to your manager so they can whitelist the country (if approved)


How to whitelist


In the admin section of Freshcaller you have to go to NUMBERS.




When select the option for RESTRICTED COUNTRIES under MANAGE NUMBERS, you get option to search for countries



After the country is selected, you can whitelist the country by selecting REMOVE RESTRICTION

title: FreshCaller_Admin Settings_Numbers_Business Hours Details
text: Business hours define the working hours of an organization. As a call center company, you may have different teams attending to customers from different time zones. With Freshcaller, you can create time zone-specific business hours for each phone number in your account and associate them with a call queue or other call workflows (IVR, Agent Extension, Voicebot, etc). TABLE OF CONTENTS How to create easy maintenance for 5 countries ( UK,DK,DE,NO,NL ) Source : How to configure business hours in Freshcaller : Freshdesk Contact Center
description:
Business hours define the working hours of an organization. As a call center company, you may have different teams attending to customers from different time zones. With Freshcaller, you can create time zone-specific business hours for each phone number in your account and associate them with a call queue or other call workflows (IVR, Agent Extension, Voicebot, etc).  


TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • How to create easy maintenance for 5 countries ( UK,DK,DE,NO,NL ) 







Source : How to configure business hours in Freshcaller : Freshdesk Contact Center

title: How to convert a Collaborator to a Full Time Agent
text: 1. **Convert the Collaborator to a Contact**: - Go to **Admin > Teams > Agents > Collaborators**. - Click on the options for the Collaborator you wish to convert to a contact. - Click **Delete**. Once deleted, the Collaborator will be moved to Contacts. 2. **Convert the Contact to an Agent**: - Go to **Customers > Contacts**. - Select the contact you want to convert into an Agent. - Click **Convert to Agent > Support - Full time agent > Convert**.
description:
1. **Convert the Collaborator to a Contact**: 
   - Go to **Admin > Teams > Agents > Collaborators**. 
   - Click on the options for the Collaborator you wish to convert to a contact. 
   - Click **Delete**. Once deleted, the Collaborator will be moved to Contacts. 

 2. **Convert the Contact to an Agent**: 
   - Go to **Customers > Contacts**. 
   - Select the contact you want to convert into an Agent. 
   - Click **Convert to Agent > Support - Full time agent > Convert**.

title: C drive is (almost) full caused by WIN SXS folder. How to clean up ?
text: NOTICE: Only for application managers !!!! The ComponentCleanup process is part of the Windows Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool. It removes unused components and reduces the size of the WinSxS folder. Here’s how you can start it manually: Method 1: Using DISM Command Open Command Prompt as Administrator: Press Win + S, type cmd, and select Run as Administrator. Run the Cleanup Command: Execute the following command: cmd CopyEdit dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup Explanation: /online: Targets the running operating system. /cleanup-image: Specifies the image to clean up. /startcomponentcleanup: Cleans up superseded and unused components. Wait for the Process to Complete: The process might take several minutes, depending on the size of the WinSxS folder and the system’s state. Method 2: With ResetBase to Prevent Rollbacks If you want to perform a more aggressive cleanup (removing old versions of components and preventing rollback to older updates): Run the following command: cmd CopyEdit dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup /resetbase Note: Using /resetbase makes it impossible to uninstall previous updates, so use it carefully. Method 3: Using Task Scheduler If you prefer to trigger ComponentCleanup through its scheduled task: Open Task Scheduler: Press Win + S, type Task Scheduler, and hit Enter. Navigate to the Task: Expand Task Scheduler Library → Microsoft → Windows → Servicing. Look for a task named StartComponentCleanup. Manually Run the Task: Right-click the task and select Run. Verify the Cleanup After the cleanup, you can check the size of the WinSxS folder to confirm the reduction: Run the following command in Command Prompt: cmd CopyEdit dir %windir%\WinSxS /s This shows the size of the folder before and after cleanup. You said:
description:
NOTICE:  Only for application managers !!!!


The ComponentCleanup process is part of the Windows Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool. It removes unused components and reduces the size of the WinSxS folder. Here’s how you can start it manually:

Method 1: Using DISM Command

  1. Open Command Prompt as Administrator:

    • Press Win + S, type cmd, and select Run as Administrator.

  2. Run the Cleanup Command: Execute the following command:

    cmd
    CopyEdit
    dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup
    • Explanation:
      • /online: Targets the running operating system.
      • /cleanup-image: Specifies the image to clean up.
      • /startcomponentcleanup: Cleans up superseded and unused components.

  3. Wait for the Process to Complete: The process might take several minutes, depending on the size of the WinSxS folder and the system’s state.

Method 2: With ResetBase to Prevent Rollbacks

If you want to perform a more aggressive cleanup (removing old versions of components and preventing rollback to older updates):

  1. Run the following command:
    cmd
    CopyEdit
    dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup /resetbase
    • Note: Using /resetbase makes it impossible to uninstall previous updates, so use it carefully.

Method 3: Using Task Scheduler

If you prefer to trigger ComponentCleanup through its scheduled task:

  1. Open Task Scheduler:

    • Press Win + S, type Task Scheduler, and hit Enter.

  2. Navigate to the Task:

    • Expand Task Scheduler Library → Microsoft → Windows → Servicing.
    • Look for a task named StartComponentCleanup.

  3. Manually Run the Task:

    • Right-click the task and select Run.

Verify the Cleanup

After the cleanup, you can check the size of the WinSxS folder to confirm the reduction:

  • Run the following command in Command Prompt:
    cmd
    CopyEdit
    dir %windir%\WinSxS /s
    This shows the size of the folder before and after cleanup.
You said:

title: How to clear the EDI queues
text: If EDI processes are running slow of stuck. Maybe inventory reports ort sales repoorts are not created anymore. You can run this SQL query in MSSMS. ! ONLY for Application Managers ! -- LET OP: Hiermee maak je de wachtrij voor de sales en invreport leeg. -- Vooraf EDI service stop -- na uitvoeren start edi service en IISRESET use DRS delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueItemStateHistory] delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueStateHistory] delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueItem] delete from [EDI].[MessageQueue]
description:
If EDI processes are running slow of stuck.

Maybe inventory reports ort sales repoorts are not created anymore.


You can run this SQL query in MSSMS.

! ONLY for Application Managers !


-- LET OP: Hiermee maak je de wachtrij voor de sales en invreport leeg.

-- Vooraf EDI service stop

-- na uitvoeren start edi service en IISRESET

use DRS

delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueItemStateHistory]

delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueStateHistory]

delete from [EDI].[MessageQueueItem]

delete from [EDI].[MessageQueue]
